nodes.title: I.1. Residential Structures Occupying Summits: Fortresses, breastworks, religious buildings, palaces, and related edifices
Chu Murti khargokChu mur ti mkhar gog
Oral tradition
nodes.body: According to local sources, Water Springs Ruined Castle was an old fortress whose leader was a figure named Gau PenjorGa'u dpal 'byor.

nodes.title: Southeast complex
nodes.body: The southern extremity of the circumvallation merges with another residential complex, consisting of a sparser arrangement of buildings. This southeast sector extends 80 m downward from the summit in a swathe 35 m wide. The precipitous nature of the east slope of the chu mur ti hill precluded the need for a defensive wall along this approach.
